unnormalised: **CBSE Class 10 Results: Aisha Khan Tops DPS, RK Puram with 98.6%**
normalised: C-B-S-E Class ten Results: Aisha Khan Tops D-P-S, R-K Puram with ninety eight point six percent

unnormalised: New Delhi – The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) declared the Class 10 results today, and Aisha Khan of Delhi Public School, RK Puram, has emerged as the school topper, securing an impressive 98.6%. The results, announced at 11:00 AM IST, have been eagerly awaited by students and parents across the country.
normalised: New Delhi – The Central Board of Board of Secondary Education (C-B-S-E) declared the Class ten results today, and Aisha Khan of Delhi Public School, R-K Puram, has emerged as the school topper, securing an impressive ninety eight point six percent. The results, announced at eleven A-M I-S-T, have been eagerly awaited by students and parents across the country.

unnormalised: Aisha, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Khan, attributed her success to consistent hard work and the support of her teachers and family. “I aimed for 95%, but scoring 98.6% is beyond my expectations,” she exclaimed, visibly elated. “Regular study hours and focusing on understanding concepts rather than rote learning were key to my success.” Her score breakdown included 99 in Maths, 98 in Science, 97 in Social Science, 99 in English, and 99 in Hindi.
normalised: Aisha, the daughter of Mister and Missus Khan, attributed her success to consistent hard work and the support of her teachers and family. “I aimed for ninety five percent, but scoring ninety eight point six percent is beyond my expectations,” she exclaimed, visibly elated. “Regular study hours and focusing on understanding concepts rather than rote learning were key to my success.” Her score breakdown included ninety nine in Maths, ninety eight in Science, ninety seven in Social Science, ninety nine in English, and ninety nine in Hindi.

unnormalised: The overall pass percentage for DPS, RK Puram, stood at 99.8%, with 35 students scoring above 95% and 150 students securing marks above 90%. The school management congratulated the students and teachers for their dedication and hard work.
normalised: The overall pass percentage for D-P-S, R-K Puram, stood at ninety nine point eight percent, with thirty five students scoring above ninety five percent and one hundred and fifty students securing marks above ninety percent. The school management congratulated the students and teachers for their dedication and hard work.

unnormalised: Nationally, the CBSE recorded a pass percentage of 93.12%, a slight dip compared to last year's 94.4%. Girls once again outperformed boys, with a pass percentage of 94.25% compared to 92.72% for boys. Trivandrum region topped the list with a pass percentage of 99.91%, followed by Chennai at 99.26% and Bengaluru at 98.64%.
normalised: Nationally, the C-B-S-E recorded a pass percentage of ninety three point one two percent, a slight dip compared to last year's ninety four point four percent. Girls once again outperformed boys, with a pass percentage of ninety four point two five percent compared to ninety two point seven two percent for boys. Trivandrum region topped the list with a pass percentage of ninety nine point nine one percent, followed by Chennai at ninety nine point two six percent and Bengaluru at ninety eight point six four percent.

unnormalised: The CBSE had conducted the Class 10 exams from 15/02/2024 to 13/03/2024 across various centers in India and abroad. This year, approximately 21 lakh students appeared for the exams.
normalised: The C-B-S-E had conducted the Class ten exams from fifteenth february two thousand and twenty four to thirteenth march two thousand and twenty four across various centers in India and abroad. This year, approximately twenty one lakh students appeared for the exams.

unnormalised: Several students expressed their relief and joy on social media, with many sharing their scores and future plans. Some plan to pursue Science in Class 11, while others are opting for Commerce or Humanities.
normalised: Several students expressed their relief and joy on social media, with many sharing their scores and future plans. Some plan to pursue Science in Class eleven, while others are opting for Commerce or Humanities.

unnormalised: The CBSE has also announced that the re-evaluation process will commence on 20/05/2024, and students who are not satisfied with their marks can apply for verification of marks through the official CBSE website. The deadline for applying for re-evaluation is 30/05/2024.
normalised: The C-B-S-E has also announced that the re-evaluation process will commence on twentieth may two thousand and twenty four, and students who are not satisfied with their marks can apply for verification of marks through the official C-B-S-E website. The deadline for applying for re-evaluation is thirtieth may two thousand and twenty four.

unnormalised: The board also mentioned that hard copies of the mark sheets will be available from the respective schools after 10/06/2024. Schools have been advised to distribute the mark sheets as soon as possible to facilitate the admission process for Class 11.
normalised: The board also mentioned that hard copies of the mark sheets will be available from the respective schools after tenth june two thousand and twenty four. Schools have been advised to distribute the mark sheets as soon as possible to facilitate the admission process for Class eleven.
